title: Birth
summary: Birth in Khyungpo Karu

title: Moves to Tengchen Monastery
summary: Moving to Tengchen Monastery under the care of his uncle

title: Tangka painting apprentice
summary: Started mural paining in his homeland in Tengchen

title: Mural painting
summary: Yungdrubling Ling monastery in Tibet

title: Became an ordained monk (Tenzin Namdak)
summary: Menri Monastery: Transferred to Menri, studied under important masters.

title: Moves to Tengchen Monastery
summary: Nepal and Mount Kailash

title: Returns from pilgramage to Yungdrung Ling monastery
summary: Studying in Yungdrung Ling monastery

title: Living and studying in the cave with yongdzin tshultrim Gyaltshen
summary: Studying under the former head teacher of  Yungdrung Ling monastery at Gyerru Do

title: Returs to Menri monastery
summary: Studying in the dialectic schools in Menri Monastery, Tibet

title: Received Geshe Degree
summary: Awarded the highest monastic degree at Menri

title: Appointed Lopön of Menri
summary: Appointed head teacher of Bön's premier monastery and became responsible for Mentri monastery in Tibet

title: Disciple Becomes 32nd Abbot of Menri
summary: Had a divinatory appointment ritual for the appointment of the Menri abbot

title: Spiritual Retreat at Dangra Lake
summary: Retreating in Sezhing monastery on the Dangra lake in northern Tibet

title: Captured and Escapes Tibet
summary: Captured, imprisoned, escaped to Nepal

title: Arrives in the UK on Rockefeller Grant
summary: Invited by David Snellgrove to SOAS, London. Supported by the Rockefeller Foundation for research

title: Returns to India
summary: Rejoined the exile Bön community

title: Founds Tibetan Bönpo Foundation in India
summary: Registered the Foundation in the indian state of Uttar Pradesh

title: Establishes Dolanji Tibetan Refugee Settlement
summary: Establishing the Dolanji Tibetan Refugee settlement in India

title: Publishes *The Nine Ways of Bön*
summary: Co-authored the first major Western academic study on Bön

title: Initiates Menri Monastery in Exile
summary: Electing the 33rd abbot, Menri Trinzin

title: Facilitates Election of 33rd Abbot of Menri
summary: Facilitated the election of the 33rd abbot of Menri after the death of the previous abbot while Rinpoche was in London, Geshe Sangye Tenzin became the 33rd abbot, who was then welcomed back from Oslo to India in November 1969. was the name of Lungtok Tenpai Nyima,

title: Visiting Scholar at University of Munich
summary: Collaborated on Tibetan-English dictionary

title: Rebuilds Menri Monastic Life in Exile
summary: Full engagement with monastic life in Menri India, printing Bön texts, reconstruction of Menri Monastery in India, engaged in teaching, practising and writing

title: Establishes Dialectic School at Menri
summary: The same year, bestowing initiation and teaching of the Gyubuchung Cunyi (twelve little tantras) to Choegyal Namkhai Norbu Rinpoche and his students who visited Menri monastery and the Bon settlement for teachings

title: Devotes Time to Teaching and Writing
summary: Teaching full time in the dialectic school of Dolanji Menri Monastery

title: Confers First Secret Empowerments
summary: Bestowing his first inner, outer, and secret empowerments of Yungdrung Bon to the lay and ordained devotees of Bön, including the 33rd abbot of Menri monastery

title: Bestows First Geshe Degree at Menri
Returns to Tibet to Bestow Teachings and Transmissions
summary: Returning to Tibet for the first time since exhile bestowing teaching and transmission to devotees of Bön, visirting several Bön monasteries in Shingatse, Qamdo, Nagqu, Stengchen, Kongpo, Zingchu, Amdo Ngaba, ordaining monks, performing rituals, and transmission, and performing the dialectic school in menri monastery Tibet, presiding over the inauguration ceremony of a new dielctic school in Ri Tsedrug monastery, appointing the abbot of Dingchen monastery, his diciples went under process of oral examination as if they were taking the geshe exam in front of the congretion of monks led by the head teacher Kinzang Lodro in Yungdrung Ling monastery

title: Founds Triten Norbutse Monastery
summary: Established the only major Bön monastery in Kathmandu, Nepal.

title: Continues Teaching at Menri in India
summary: Teaching at Menri while supervising the construction of Triten Norbutse in Nepal

title: Begins First Western Teaching Tour
summary: Taught Dzogchen in the UK, USA, Italy at the invitation of Namkhai Norbu

title: Teaches Dzogchen Across the West
summary: France, UK, Germany, Switzerland, Austria, USA, Mexico, Holland, Argentina, Thailand

title: Attends Kalachakra with H.H. Dalai Lama invitation
Second Return to Tibet for Teachings
summary: Meeting with heirs of Shen lineage, Norbu Wangyal, visiting several Bon monasteries in Nagqu, Qamdo, Teng-chen, bestowing local monks initiation, transmission, teaching, and ordinating monks, consecrating and performing and teaching rituals

title: Third Visit to Tibet and Rituals in Lhasa
summary: Meeting Shen Norbu Wangyal and his sons in Lhasa, meeting with the 33rd abbot in Lhasa and performing rituals together with him for devotees

title: Inaugurates New Temple at Triten Norbutse
summary: Establishing the dialecting and meditation school at Triten Norbutse

title: Appoints Triten Norbutse Council
summary: Drafting the structure and function of the Triten Norbutse

title: Leads Bön Mandala Project in Osaka
summary: Cooperation with the National Museum of Ethnology in Osaka, supervising the painting of 130 mandalas from the relevant text of the Bön religion, which were exhibited and collected in the museum, giving instructions for the writing and publishing of the Bon Mandalas

title: Fourth Return to Tibet for Teaching and Ordinations
summary: Meeting Shen Norbu Wangyal and a number of monasteries in Teng-chen and Ba chen consecrating, initiating and giving transmissions in these monasteries, inaugurating the dialectic school in Teng-chen monastery, sponsoring and initiating the Tibetan medical school in Teng-chen county

title: Bestowing First Geshe Degree at Triten Norbutse
summary: Bestowing First Geshe Degree at Triten NorbutseTriten Norbutse Monastery

title: Electing the abbot of Triten Norbutse
summary: Appointed his disciple Jeru Geshe Tenpa Yungdrung as the abbot of Triten Norbutse Monastery

title: Bestows Series of Secret Empowerments
summary: Bestows Series of Secret Empowerments to lay and monastic community at Triten Norbutse monastery

title: Founds Shenten Dargye Ling Retreat Centre
summary: Established French retreat centre; Bön recognised in France

title: Publishes 13-Volume Collected Works
summary: Publication in India

title: French Government Recognises Shenten Dargye Ling
summary: By the Ministry of the Interior of the French government

title: Relocates Tibetan Medical School to Triten Norbutse
summary: Relocating the Tibet Medical School from Dhorpatan to Triten Norbutse

title: Final Return to Tibet and Ordains 150 Monks
summary: Meeting Shen Norbu Wangyal, Gyalse yungrung Gyalwa, giving teachings and transmissions of the primary practice to the family members of Shen and meeting devotees from various parts of Tibet, ordaining more than 150 monks, identifying and visiting Bon sacred sites

title: Visits Zhu Rizhing and Blesses New Sites
summary: Visiting Zhu Rizhing Yungdrung Kundragling, inaugurating the meditation school there and visiting the newly purchased site for the future school of Sheing Phunthogling Bon Society in India, blessing and consecrating the site where the Tise Himalayan International School by Triten Norbutse would be located

title: Oversees Stupa Construction at Shenten
summary: Presiding over the stupa construction of the Yungdrung Loeg stupa

title: Sends Relics Back to Menri in Tibet
summary: Sending back two important images to the Menri monastery in Tibet

title: Completes Dzogchen Transmission to Western Lay Practitioners
summary: Bestowing transmission and teachings of Zhang Zhung Nyengund Kagyud Korzhi completely to lay practitioners of the summer retreat of Shenten

title: Guides 34th Abbot Election at Menri
summary: Provides instructions for the 34th election of the Menri abbot

title: Blesses 34th Abbot and Supports School Opening
summary: Supporting the opening of the Tise Himalayan school, presiding over the Dutrisu ceremony in the autumn retreat of Shenten

title: Begins Construction of New Temple at Triten Norbutse
Celebrates 95th Birthday with Devotees
summary: Joined by housands of devotees from various countries of the East and West

title: Publishes Complete 22-Volume Collected Works
summary: Publishing the full 22. volume of his works and the second edition of the 13 volumes of the previous works

title: Moves into New Residence at Completed Temple
Inaugurates New Temple During Centennial
summary: During the 100th year ceremony

title: 100th Birthday Celebration
summary: Centennial celebrated with 6000 devotees

title: Enters Thukdam and Parinirvana
summary: Passed away peacefully on June 12 during Saga Dawa
